exception.name: ErrorCertificateExpired
exception.description: This exception is thrown if a SE API function is invoked and the certificate corresponding to a private key used to create log messages is expired. Even if a certificate is expired, the log message SHALL be created by the Secure Element and stored by the device. In this case, the exception ErrorCertificateExpired SHALL be raised only after the data of the log message has been stored. This is a warning exception that indicates the operation succeeded but with a certificate validity concern.

javadoc.summary: This class defines the exception ErrorCertificateExpired that is thrown if a SE API function is invoked and the certificate with the public key for the verification of the appropriate type of log messages is expired.
javadoc.description: The ErrorCertificateExpired exception indicates that a function has successfully completed its primary operation (creating and storing a log message), but the certificate used for signing the log message has expired. Unlike typical exception scenarios where the operation fails, this exception is raised AFTER the log message has already been created and stored by the Secure Element. This design ensures that log messages are persisted even when the signing certificate is no longer valid, maintaining logging continuity. Applications should treat this as a warning condition indicating that certificate renewal or replacement may be necessary, while acknowledging that the log message operation succeeded. The expired certificate does not prevent logging but does indicate a potential security or compliance issue that requires attention.

specification.requirement: The exception SHALL be raised if a function is invoked and the certificate corresponding to a private key used to create log messages is expired. Even if a certificate is expired, the log message SHALL be created by the Secure Element and stored by the device. In this case, the exception ErrorCertificateExpired SHALL be raised only after the data of the log message has been stored. This ensures that logging continues despite certificate expiration, but the application is notified of the certificate validity issue.
specification.applicability: Functions that create log messages or perform logging operations when the signing certificate is no longer valid

condition.scenario: Log message creation with expired certificate
condition.description: Function performs logging operation while the certificate used for log message signing is expired (notAfter date has passed)
condition.trigger: During execution of a logging function, the Secure Element checks certificate validity. The certificate's expiration date (notAfter) is in the past. The Secure Element creates and signs the log message anyway, stores it successfully, and then signals this condition by allowing ErrorCertificateExpired to be raised.

condition.scenario: Multiple functions accessing expired certificate simultaneously
condition.description: Multiple logging functions may raise this exception if they all use the same expired certificate for log message signing
condition.trigger: Different logging functions (initialize, updateTime, startTransaction, etc.) all invoke log message creation while sharing an expired certificate. Each successful operation raises ErrorCertificateExpired.

executionSequence.step: User/application calls a logging function (e.g., initialize, updateTime, finishTransaction, etc.)
Function requests log message creation from Secure Element
Secure Element checks certificate validity for log message signing
If certificate is NOT expired → log message created and stored normally, no exception raised
If certificate IS expired → continue anyway to ensure logging continuity
Secure Element creates and signs log message using expired certificate
Device stores the log message data successfully
Function raises ErrorCertificateExpired AFTER storage succeeds
Function returns to caller with exception and successful operation result

recovery.step: Verify that operation succeeded despite the exception - log message was created and stored
Identify the expired certificate from exception message or device logs
Check certificate validity period to understand expiration timeline
Plan certificate renewal or replacement to prevent persistent expiration
Implement proactive certificate monitoring before expiration dates
Review logging procedures to ensure continued operation during certificate transitions

postconditionality.state: Log message successfully created and stored - operation completed despite certificate expiration
Exception raised AFTER storage succeeds - ensures log message persistence
Certificate remains expired - no automatic renewal occurs
Device state changed - log message now persisted in storage
Signing certificate validity concern noted - application should plan for certificate management
Function returns successfully to caller despite raising exception - log operation did not fail

notes.note: Indication: A logging operation completed successfully, but the signing certificate has expired - operation succeeded despite certificate validity issue
Topics: Certificate Management, Logging Operations, Certificate Validation, Secure Element Operations

scenario.name: Scenario 1: Certificate Expiration Detection and Notification
scenario.description: A logging operation completes successfully and raises ErrorCertificateExpired. The application catches this exception, identifies that the logging certificate has expired, and logs a warning message for system administrators indicating that certificate renewal is needed.
scenario.errorContext: Certificate expiration detected during logging - renewal required

scenario.name: Scenario 2: Graceful Degradation with Certificate Monitoring
scenario.description: An application continues normal operation on ErrorCertificateExpired since the log message was stored successfully. The application tracks certificate expiration occurrences and triggers a certificate management procedure when a threshold is reached.
scenario.errorContext: Operation succeeded despite expired certificate - tracking certificate validity state

scenario.name: Scenario 3: Proactive Certificate Management
scenario.description: The application monitors certificate expiration by catching ErrorCertificateExpired exceptions. When the exception is raised, the application queries the device for certificate information, calculates remaining validity, and schedules certificate renewal operations accordingly.
scenario.errorContext: Certificate management - expiration awareness - renewal scheduling

scenario.name: Scenario 4: Audit Trail and Compliance Logging
scenario.description: ErrorCertificateExpired exceptions are logged to an audit trail for compliance purposes. The application records each occurrence with timestamp, affected function, and certificate details to maintain comprehensive security and compliance records.
scenario.relatedFunctions: all logging functions with certificate creation
scenario.errorContext: Audit trail recording - compliance logging - certificate lifecycle tracking
